3: C-can't move...
How?!
The response is not catching up...
I won't give up... Sophia... merchant... keeps her end of the deal.

2: There has to be a way.

3: That's right! If we do it together...
The Gray Raven Commandant is standing up, so... I...!
The Rail Heterozygote keeps making twister, piercing shrieks. You cannot tell if it is roaring or wailing, crying or laughing.
It doesn't matter what it is.
Bianca pats Sophia on her head before carrying her bow and walks to the front of the Rail Heterozygote.
I understood that there was no God in this world a long time ago, Sophia.
God does not help regardless of my prayers. But I never stop praying... praying to myself.
I'm not praying for an answer from God. I'm seeking the answer deep within me.
Seeking the answer... within you?
At that moment, a breeze swirls around Bianca as she draws her bow, her figure divine like a saint.
Her left hand raises the bow as the string draws tight. Overclocked particles hover in the air.
Commandant, can you give me a hand?
You heard the commandant! Everyone, attack!
I can also... create a window of opportunity!
Fire.
The speeding arrow launches with her command, hitting the gargantuan body of the Rail Heterozygote at the one single spot she was aiming.
—The Rail Heterozygote seizes functioning.
